content.question: Energy is transferred along food chains from one stage to the next. Which statement best explains how the energy is transferred?

choices.label: If a primary consumer stores <math alttext="100 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy, then a secondary consumer that feeds on the primary consumer will also have <math alttext="100 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy available.

If a primary producer stores <math alttext="10,000 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy, then a tertiary consumer will have <math alttext="10 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy available.

If a primary producer stores <math alttext="100,000 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>100</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy, then a secondary consumer will have <math alttext="10,000 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy available.

If a secondary consumer stores <math alttext="500 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>500</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy, then a tertiary consumer that feeds on the secondary consumer will have <math alttext="5,000 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy available.

content.answer: If a primary producer stores <math alttext="10,000 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>000</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy, then a tertiary consumer will have <math alttext="10 kilocalories" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>kcal</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy available.

skill.text: Skill 6.C: Calculate an accurate numeric answer with appropriate units.
